I bought this expecting to get some cheap jumpscares and (judging from the screenshots etc) generally broken/buggy gameplay. Also thought I'd be laughing my ass off more than being afraid.

My actual experience of the game can be summarized by the following brief tale:
A friend and I were playing, we'd ticked off 2/3 evidence for what ghost it was and went back to the truck to get more things to test for the final piece.
Upon re-entering the house, we heard the ghost lady singing away merrily in a bedroom. After a brief discussion, my friend decided to shout "hey you ghost b**** keep on singing you b****"
At which point the lights flickered like mad, the front door slammed shut and locked behind us and the ghost lady, quite offended at being called a b****, came charging out of the room and promptly murdered my friend in front of me.
My friend told me he was a ghost now and could help me scout out the rest of the house so we could complete the mission. To which I responded by crouching facing a wall away from the ghost saying I can't do this alone.
He told me to stop being a b**** to which I said I can't do this and quit the game.

I never expected to be so terrified in a horror game where I realized I was too weak to keep going.

I could make a giant list of all the things that are amazing about this game. But when a horror game succeeds with its atmosphere and oppression so damn well that I end up quitting (and I used to regard myself as something of a horror game veteran, but this game has made me realized I'm just a singing lady's b****), I have to take my hat off to it.

10/10 going to the store to buy new pants again.

Not sure what is scarier, the bugs or the game itself.  I've never once got the spirit box to work despite the mic test saying Im good. TL; DR: 
Com amigos é um excelente jogo, tem bugs, tem seus problemas, movimentação super simples, mas jogando com os amigos simplesmente vai perder o sono pela tensão e a hora vai voar!

Um excelente jogo de suspense! Não é um jogo onde se espera levar jumpscare e sair gritando igual louco… bom talvez no início seja tudo amedrontante, mas após umas partidas [COM AMIGOS] e começar a entender a mecânica do game deixa de ser o "terror" que talvez muitos classificam. 

É um jogo onde é criada uma preparação para descobrir qual tipo de fantasma você deve reportar, ou seja, você não vai para a caçada e sim para investigação, e quando as coisas apertam quem faz a caça é a entidade. 

O jogo está bem cruzinho por enquanto, bastante bugs e afins, mas para uma versão 0.1 está muito bem trabalhado em cima, claro, tem muito para se alterar, movimentação, padrões das entidades etc, mas com um bom toque dos devs creio que vão conseguir alimentar muito bem o game, por experiencia, recomendo jogar nos servidores [US] para evitar desconexões e frustrações.

Portanto, se você tem amigos que queiram jogar e se divertir com momentos de tensão, compre e vá fundo! USE O VOIP DO JOGO EVITE DISCORD principalmente pela mecânica de chamar entidade e afins. No estado que está eu já recomendo e espero após o lançamento poder atualizar a review e dizer ainda mais coisas boas sobre o jogo.

The ONLY game I've ever bought where I feel like I've not only gotten the full value of the game, but even more! This game NAILS atmosphere, and perfects terror to a new degree! I would happily pay $25 for this game! Granted, I've only experienced this game in VR, so I dont quite know how this holds up in desktop, but the vr experience is unlike anything I've ever seen! If you've seen this online and are skeptical about it due to popularity, I highly suggest putting that to the side and picking it up for yourself!

my only gripe with the game is the controls are really jank, like REALLY jank. The hands dont quite line up with your irl ones, and theres no finger tracking, plus the grabbing system needs a lot of work, However, once you get used to the jank controlers, they're easy to work around.

Definitely recommend, and hopefully they provide more content (I'm completely fine with paying more for DLC).

Things I'd like to see added:

-Gamma slider in options

-Thermal Cam
-Laser Grid
-EVP recorder & playback
-Ability to erase / recharge the cameras still-pictures

||More supernatural beings: 
-Werewolves 
-Vampires
-Aliens (and more non-spiritual beings, bigfoot, hex in/around the house, etc)
-Fake-calls (catching homeowners/building-owners trying to fake a haunting - possibly via thermal reader/cam to catch heat prints)
-Non Ghosts: Solving the case by detecting just natural home happenings (lose pipes, old wood, or lose animals in the house at night)

Ghosts to sometimes whisper on the phone if they call

Allow dead players to keep playing by allowing:
Them to help by writing messages on mirrors/glass/windows
Allow them to investigate after death
Answer messages via spirit box by word multiple choice (to help accuracy & prevent trolling with free voice)

Example:
Teammate 1 says with spirit box active: "Does the entity have -insert term- on their -insert body area- (for example: "on their back")
Dead Teammate 2s screen shows multiple answers on screen to select  ("Yes", "No", "Checking Now".
The idea behind this, would be to have a few different entities share the same detail so that way the dead teammate can help, but not instantly-solve the what the entity is.

Overall, I love this game.

This game is amazingly addictive! The best experience is definitely with a group of friends to laugh and have a good time with! However even playing single player as you try to figure out which ghost is haunting the house/school/etc. is a blast. This game is still early in it's development and updates are sure to come through the pipeline which means the game can only go up from here!

The only concern I hope the game addresses is the movement speed. I personally feel like the movement speed is to slow and that the character feels like he's at a crawl instead of a "brisk" walk. My recommendation would be to bump up the movement speed slightly more to a moderate walk and then increase each ghosts movement speed accordingly.

Other than that it's a fantastic game and definitely worth the price!

This game is best experienced in VR. I play in VR 95% of the time, for more reasons than just the scare factor alone (the game is scary by itself, 1000x moreso in VR.) In VR, you are able to hold 4 items vs 3 (2 on your belt, and 2 in your hands). In VR, you can more easily manipulate objects to lean them how you’d like, or place candles and other items more precisely. Lighting things with the lighter is also 10x easier in VR.

It is a very good game. It is one of a kind and like a proper ghost hunting simulator. The sanity pills however seem to be broken as of update 2 however im sure itll be fixed by the next update. I believe they should also either be 2 use or cheaper to purchase as they are too expensive for a one use item.

This is THE FIRST horror game I've played that got me hooked. Playing in either VR or Desktop mode is amazing. Definitely more scary in VR especially while alone. It has a massive replay value due to having multiple maps/ghosts/difficulties/team size/ETC. My most recommended Horror/VR Game for sure. Walking out of a school in pitch black night with the door closing behind you and hearing a scream from the person who was in the back is suspenseful. Immediately yelling at them to hide. The atmosphere brings it all together.

Recommendation to DEV: Give ghosts a more creepy edge at certain times/difficulties. Throwing objects AT players would be frightful. Hearing whispers when sanity is low. Either way, you are killing it! So glad there is more to come!

If possible I'd like to see the devs add in some more objectives such as figuring out the cause of the haunting, and if it's more or less malicious in nature, make the ghosts feel just a hair bit more unique when you come across them, because at one point we had all the evidence point towards a poltergeist and it was just CONSTANTLY throwing things around in a kitchen, and it turned out to be something else instead i forget what exactly it was, but we were confused because i think we needed it to write or to having freezing temperatures and we NEVER got either of those...which made absolutely no sense to us. And to add in some more things with the spirit box i LOVE the spirit box so much but i wish there was a wider array of things the ghosts would respond to, like it would be cool if you could walk in to the room sit down and immediately choose a passive route or an aggressive route the aggressive route being "Show me your presence" and the passive route being "We just want to talk" those lines of questions would be awesome and more ghosts of course, another neat idea would be a mimic ghost, my idea for this would be a super aggressive but lone hunter ghost, so you stay together to be more safe, but if you're alone it will target the activity around the person who is alone, thus confusing the hunters as to where it actually is and adding in the suspense of being alone in a house that much more because you KNOW if it's a mimic or another ghost that wants to be alone, it'll definitely be more comfortable attacking you while separated, of course keeping the namesake of the mimic by allowing it to give any piece of evidence however the evidence that it does give this way is very rare, as an example let it interact with the spirit box, to say one or two things, but after that have it cut all response to the spirit box for a time this will force the player to stay ALONE in a dark room with a highly aggressive ghost, another cool thing to experiment with is the ghosts turning things in your hands off and upping the frequency of this if it's a poltergeist as they manipulate objects a LOT, and being able to leave fingerprints ON equipment as well, so if you interact with the spirit box and it gets shut off on you, you can scan it with a UV and see if there's a finger print on it, same with a flashlight, if possible have the ghosts slam the ghost writing journal in your hands. I absolutely love this game and if the devs would let me i would LOVE to be someone you can bounce idea's back and forth off of, not only for different kinds of ghosts but different actions the ghosts can take that would really frighten or unsettle players. Imagine if you will someone flashlight being turned off three times in the span of a minute or two how creepy that would be, especially with the flickering lights mechanic as well. As for my actual review of the game it's absolutely wonderful and i love it to death, it's SO MUCH FUN with friends, however for the people who can't get friends to play maybe consider adding in smaller houses with more places to hide in? Like an apartment complex has a haunted room maybe and you have two "rooms" to investigate that are open to you that each have 3 small rooms inside and a bathroom? Something to think about for sure. If you're interested in contacting me about this i'll leave my twitter link here feel free to DM me i also have comments turned on as well, thank you for designing such an awesome game and i hope to see this game grow going forward! https://twitter.com/CaptainJMouse

This has to be one of my favorite supernatural games to date. Its grounded aproach to the setting is immaculate and is way better at creating fear than some big set piece and over the top plot other games can achieve. Anyone that grew up watching ghost hunting tv shows will cherish this game. The voice mechanics in the game are also so innovative and creepy. The various maps that you can investigate are also incredible, some are gross and creepy farmhouses that seem obviously haunted. Others are normal suburban houses that dont seem scary but that serves to make the fear better when you are being attacked in a place that feels safer and new. The bigger maps are also excellent, playing into the fear that everyone has of the local abandonded school or asylum. All in all this game is a perfect example of how a scary game can be made with modest means. Very excited for future updates. 10/10 would buy again.

WOW!... Developers!... Keep up the development!!!

A surprisingly well-made ghost hunting game, with some impressive lighting, models, and graphics for a game using the Unity engine!
This game easily captures the true fear of real ghost hunts, and gives the player a new horror experience every time with different types of spirits and ghosts to hunt, as well as different places around the country to hunt such spirits.

Once the developers add more things to this game, I wouldn't be surprised to see this game blow up!  The game will absolutely thrive if the developers add more maps around the world, new ways to complete contracts, new game modes, unlockable cosmetics for completing contracts or achievements, new items to search for ghosts, or maybe ways to DEFEAT ghosts?...  Added with a fresh polish update to the quality of life, the list just keeps goin!

The cherry on top of this sweet game is the VR support!  A heart attack waiting to happen, but great feature to have!

A good pickup for the 2020 Halloween stay-in season!

P.S.

Some Ghostbusters-inspired items or game modes would be a WONDERFUL welcome to the game...  ;)

Pretty good game that I eagerly await more content for from the developer.

Atmosphere is great, doesn't rely on cheap jumpscares for the most part outside of having a ghost suddenly growl in your in one of your ears while giving you a back massage while you attempt to hide yourself in the bathroom from them.

Ghost designs are pretty good but them holding their weapons are a little bit goofy after you've grown used to them from extended play.

Gameplay is solid, you get what you pay for. A game about hunting ghosts using ghost hunting equipment with some other ghost hunters, though the animations could use a bit of work because looking straight up makes your character basically snap his/her spine while they turn into a walking L shape.

Equipment is varied with more to hopefully be added soon though some of the equipment can seem relatively useless like the parabolic sound sensors and wall mounted objects.

Ghosts come in various types with varied appearances with more to also be added soon hopefully.

----------

As for improvements I would like to see:

1) More emphasis on underused equipment like the wall mounted objects and parabolic sound sensor. Because currently the thermometer is basically the be all end all of finding what room the ghost is in.

2) The ability for the ghost to move from room to room to keep the hunters guessing. As the hunt basically consists of "I have found the room the ghost is in" to which everyone dogpiles into one room for the rest of the match sprinkling salt and 2 crucifixes onto the floor to lock the ghost down while everyone proceeds to antagonize it until it hunts to which everyone runs for the hills out of the room because there's a high chance the ghost will begin the hunt from where you find it.

3) More emphasis on the ghost's strenghts and weaknesses. As the ghosts are supposed to have strengths and weaknesses that you play around, but they don't feel different from eachother at all. Any ghost i've caught feels the exact same as the last ghost outside of how frequently they attack between more passive ghosts and more aggressive ghosts

4) Maybe an extra inventory slot for non VR players? Vr players are able to carry 4 objects since they can use seperate hands while us normal plebs are restricted to 3 items because we can't use our hands seperately.

5) More variety from the scares. As the game is scary don't get me wrong. But after i've played for 8 hours straight, having the same ghost spawn in with the same Death rattle sound effect standing their harmlessly in the corner of the room just kinda leads to me running face first into the ghost to mock it before it despawns because i've grown to expect it when i'm sitting in the corner of a room alone antagonizing the ghost with a ouija board and spirit box. 

The moments where the game truely makes the hairs on my neck stand up are when the game throws something at me i'm not ready for, but these are completely coincidental. Such as me walking into a room in my last game and getting an absolute faceful of a ghost that decided to spawn in my face in the door way without a sound as me and another hunter walk into the room which caused both of use to shit our pants for a moment.

------

As the game is currently though I rate it at a 8/10 for an early access co-op ghost hunting simulator.

I'll bump it to a 10/10 and write more details on my review once I see more content added to the game hopefully. The developer seems to be keeping up with patching the game currently as he made smudge sticks less oppressive against the ghost attacking and has already fixed a few obnoxious bugs such as the "Zombie" bug.

But I've gotta see that the dev is going to add more content such as maps, equipment and ghost types and isn't gonna turn around and dump the game before I turely bump the game up to a 10/10

Keep up the good work Kinetic games!

This game's premise is fantastic, and the execution is quite good considering there is only one developer. Granted this game still needs quite a bit of polish, mostly pertaining to the player models which, comically, would change the color of their skin to whatever surface they clipped into while looking up. If you can get past some of the jank, its a great experience. 
   The atmosphere is perfect, namely because of how subdued everything is. Whats more terrifying, some pre-canned jumpscare that only gets you the first time, or the sense of dread you feel when a emf detector spikes and the lights go out. This isnt some constant thriller, jump scare simulator, its an organic experience that slowly builds into despair and terror. 
   Overall, good for what it is, great as an idea. I would definitely recommend this to any fan of slower paced horror games, especially if they own VR.

This game manifests one of the most serious and actual interactive ghost hunting game you can come across as of now. Most other games like this follow a linear path and design, most often not including many variations and random generation, unlike Phasmophobia. This game utilizes some of the most classical remarks on ghost hunting in real life, making it a mold of realism doused with horror and gameplay. The VR extends this experience tenfold and it is a very nice addition to coincide with PC users. Despite all the mechanics and features this game manages well, it masters and excels in anticipation. Anticipation is the true horror of this game, offering no timing, explanation, or depiction of when something will happen, and the thoughts that instill in your mind is the part that truly comes to haunt you.

4. Do it again because it’s fun.

EDIT:

So I have now played enough hours to check out its pros and cons. It has a good potential and has a lot of areas that can be improved.

Pros:
-Realistic atmosphere
-"Equipment" based on real life investigations
-Ghosts look terrifying
-Ghosts sound terrifying
-no cheap jumpscares
-There is build up
-Each ghost type is unique
-Voice activated ghost response is genius
-Fun with friends and even strangers
-In-game voice chat is superb and adapts to environment. (it will echo in wide spaces indoors)
-spoopy maps

Cons:
-Ghost has no movement animation
-Ghost vocabulary in spirit box is very limited like under 5 words or so
-YOU LITERALLY CANT "RUN". YOU WALK LIKE A BABY AND THE SHIFT GIVES LIKE +1 SPEED UP.
-Some maps are too large to check each room, no hints where ghost room might be. (Asylum, school).
-This kid ghost said she's an adult and appeared as a child (yikes).

A very strong combination of mundane horror in terms of atmospheric ambiance and immediate, (meta)physical horror when the ghost decides you've stayed too long. The mounting dread is killer in these otherwise normal houses as you attempt to uncover just what sort of spirit is haunting your location. A very fun game to play with friends; a very terrifying game to play alone. 

With two quick patches already, this early access horror title is very promising in my opinion. The random ghost type each time certainly allows for replayability, and the handful of locations already in add to the variety. I am optimistic about future updates; I would certainly like to see more ghost types and activity, and definitely more locations. The items could be tweaked more, and perhaps more could be included, but for now they do the job well.

My personal opinion?  The game right now is easily a 4/5. I give it a 4 because there are bound to be more bugs yet to be squashed, and there certainly is more content on the horizon to anticipate. But rest assured, this game is definitely playable as-is despite being early access. If you aren't convinced, watch a video or stream! Here's to October with all its many spooky promises!

This game captures what most horror games don't, it's not a slasher title with a sub standard antagonist. Atmosphere and detail of the environment really sets the scene well, no room is safe from the departed. 

What works really well is the build up of anticipation of capturing a paranormal event and the suspense that creeps in while exploring your surroundings.

The environmental sounds help create a sense of dread as you explore and send tingles up your spine. This really works well in tandem with the assets and layout of the areas you explore.

As for the ghosts, these are delivered excellently as they appear at the right time and their design is nothing short of terrifying. All I'll say is don't underestimate them.

TLDR: A horror game worth playing solo and with a group of friends! Good luck ghost hunters

This is the best horror game i've played in some time. My friends and I have been having 2-2.5 hour sessions for the past 3 nights. Phasmophobia doesn't rely on jumpscares. In fact, there are no intentional jumpscares in the game at all. Instead, it goes for intensity and psychological horror. It has its problems, but its still in early access so that is to be expected. The character models aren't to good looking, the walking animations are very (enjoyably) stupid, and there's many bugs. But the graphics are surprisingly very good, the environments are scary, and the gameplay is very intense. I highly recommend this game if you and your friends want to get scared. (Play in VR for the best experience. Much more immersive and frightening)

Intense and scary game, immersive atmosphere, great jump scares. Items could be made cheaper or the penalty for dying is a little expensive (losing 50% of the value of items you brought in). Or make it such that the penalty scales with the number/percentage of survivors who "escape" alive.

E.g. team of 4, -25% for each death. Team of 3, -30% for each death. Team of 2, -40% for each death. Solo, -50% for dying. This will also encourage people to play alone to not risk losing all their hard earned money. To prevent people from just bailing and running when 1 person dies, make it a requirement to correctly guess the ghost type.  A wrong guess means a flat -50% penalty.

This is WELL worth the price tag of early access.

The game has both PC and VR access, and I'm writing from the PC player PoV.

This game has it all. Spooky atmosphere, various ghosts, and typical freaky locations you'd never want to be caught stuck with a murderous ghost in (plus some ones close to home).

The potential for memes is there, with voiceless gremlins locking your team in instead of the ghost, or the guy on VR who's played this game for hundreds of hours already, screaming at you about NOT hiding in the corner when shit hits the fan. 

It's already made a great impact with me in terms of enjoyment, so I think it's worth the price tag. The fact that the game keeps getting updates is also a good sign of its potential future development. For an early access game, it feels pretty polished. Will you put down the game for stretches of time? Sure. Is it worth the money that it's currently listed at? If you got a microphone and a headset, 100% yes. (If not, microphone elitists will kick you out of their games -- you have been warned :c )

This game is absolutely amazing. Insanely fun with randoms, and endlessly hilarious with friends. Replay value of the missions added so far is high. He also pops in streamers streams and watches them play, which hints towards receptive to feedback. Fixes bugs and adds quality of life tweaks with every update. Made by one guy from what I hear, super astonished at the work and magic he's put together with this. 30 hours in and I just want more, hasn't turned me off in a "this is getting repetitive sense", I just feel myself getting better, more efficient, or more "professional" at ghost hunting with all my pals. It does have some bugs, like a couple of times I walked through the wall and got teleported back to the truck, but I havent experienced anything gamebreaking. There's also a bunch of PC players playing without mic, but it's no problem kicking them from a game or finding a game with people who has a mic. Microphone is important as you need to be able to talk and listen to other players, and work together to complete the job. Especially at harder difficulties. Also it's 10 times as fun.

Not going to lie, I NEVER leave Steam reviews, but this game deserves it.  Probably the most terrifying game yet interesting game ive ever played.  I HIGHLY recommend playing this game with friends. It takes coordination and planning to investigate, but if you go in guns blazing and cameras flashing, you WILL get your cheeks clapped by a ghost/demon/entity/etc.  One of the best games I've played and it deserves a lot more attention than it gets, especially because it has so few developers and they release patches all the time and updates.  Y'all really deserve a round of applause for this one boys.  Definitely worth the money (honestly, in my opinion, its at least a $20-$25 game).

Prefacing this by saying I do not play with VR.

Everything runs incredibly smooth, but character models look just absolutely awful (presumably because they're preexisting assets). The way other players' bodies move is just so unnatural it's funny; rather than turning their heads up if they look up, their ENTIRE back arches backwards while they somehow maintain balance and it's just incredible. You can see your teammate's entire upper body poking through the door of a locker if they look up or down. This definitely needs to be changed eventually, because while funny, it doesn't help the theme of this game being horror.

The way you move is definitely too slow. You move at a snail's pace, and "running" honestly barely has a difference that it may as well be the normal walking speed. Which is still too slow. I understand that I'm not running a mile in an open world setting, the maps are very contained, but it definitely takes away from the sense of realism. Realistic walking speed with no option to run would be better than this.

The controls need to be streamlined as well. I don't quite understand why E can't be both the interact and pick-up button, and I find myself forgetting constantly to press F to interact while I instinctively press E. And then left click is also an interact button for light switches, and to turn the camera on, which I don't understand either. These could all be contained in 1 button if the right rules were set to prevent them from overlapping.

Despite all of these flaws, the game is just fun. Talking into your mic to get the ghost to respond really helps the illusion that you're there. Using a walkie-talkie to communicate across distances with your teammates also sells the illusion, and what really makes it spooky is that when a ghost is hunting the walkie-talkie will frizz up and it doesn't seem like you can communicate with anyone unless they're near you.

It's also fun trying to deduce where the ghost is in a coordinated setting, and what to do to get it to respond, and what to use to make sure you're getting the right evidence. And even when you figure out what the ghost is, the match doesn't have to be over. You still have evidence to collect, pictures to take, optional objectives to complete, all for extra cash. You can leave whenever you feel satisfied...if you don't die.

The ghost will hunt players eventually, and the scene that plays out when you're captured is a bit spooky to me still. You'll also get flashes of the ghost to witness their whereabouts, or hear them whisper in your ear, or make creepy grudge-like noises, or they'll turn a radio on or call a telephone or you'll just hear them taking a damn step. And it keeps me on edge and on the lookout. Having to rely on both audio and visuals helps solidify the experience that you're a paranormal investigator.

Emphasis on investigator, by the way. NOT a ghost hunter. You're not stopping whoever this ghost is, you're here to get evidence, survive, and get paid.

I don't even really have a whole point to this review, it's just a bunch of rambling thoughts I have about the game. It's amazing with friends, even strangers, and $14 is a steal given the replayability.

I'm excited to see how polished it becomes in the future, and what they'll add next.

I used to run Ghost Tours/Hunts at Asylum 49, A haunted Hospital featured on Ghost Adventures and other paranormal shows, Unfortunately I we have had to stop due to the current state of the world, Before that I was ghost hunting almost every other night with a few close friends as my team.
With All that backstory out of the way, This game gets my seal of approval! We have been missing paranormal investigating ever since and this game perfectly captures that feel. All of the equipment feels exactly like I expected it too, The in game voice chat is GENIUS! having proximity chat that follows the characters in 3d space, and then needing to use walkie talkies for long distance is perfect!
Not to mention for an Early Access title it was extremely polished, we ran into no bugs at all.
If you enjoy Ghost Hunting, Paranormal Shows like Ghost Adventures, or just want a good horror game to play with friends, this game is perfect for you.
I couldn't recommend it more!

A few recommendations to the Devs is to differentiate a little more on the physical characteristics of each ghost. Give the Banshee characteristics of that of Irish folklore and the Oni that of Japanese folklore. Adding characteristics to the ghosts might give away what type of ghost it is, so this might be a touchy recommendation. The game is great on non VR but im sure the immersion and scariness is 100x better on VR. Definitely need more contracts (maps) which I'm sure will be added. Playing solo is fine but you definitely want friends; or you can join lobbys with randoms. This review will be edited surely as new content gets added. Phasmophobia has potential. Good game so far. Eager to see what the Devs add.

shit my pants

This game is amazing for Youtube and Twitch. In the last three days I have spent 33.6% of my total time playing.

Pros:
VR: This game was made with VR in mind. The tool belt allows you to turn on items and use them while using your hands for other tasks. You can use an emf and spirt box on your hips while holding a uvb light to become a one man army. In VR you can use both of your hands and it makes the game much more interactive.
Movement in vr is smooth and has options to allow smooth locomotion or teleport for more comfort. I find the teleport to be very jank to use in game and would rather take the motion sickness hit than use it.

VR jank: I have had issues walking through door ways in VR. Sometimes my body gets caught on the door and it just holds me in front of it. I have clipped into tables, been thrown under the level and received a one way ticket back to the van. I am using the Oculus Quest with PC link and have had issues with certain items on my left tool belt not being able to be picked up. The item just sticks to my belt teleportation between my hand and the belt. 

Dynamic and localised sounds! This game has a wonderful use of localised sounds where you only  hear the sounds happening immediately around your player, including the voice chat. Certain levels use echos to increase the dynamics, items like balls bouncing down the hallways cause a ripple of echos that you may here on one end of the level and a friend hears it on another. The game will play audio through the side of your headset that the sound is coming from and works wonderfully in VR and on PC.

This game is much better with a group! I have been playing in 4 player private lobbies and public lobbies and have had a great experience in both. P.s. if you want a private lobby make a private lobby don't kick players for joining if your lobby is public. The more players you have the more complex strategies you can preform. With a member in the van you can monitor several area of the map and it makes the game more interactive and exciting when everybody has a job to do. 

Big spoop: This game has an amazing atmosphere where you are listening to everything that happens around you waiting for the ghost to strike. The subtle sounds such as clock tics slowing down when the ghost is near,  the creaking of stairs under your feet, and the door jiggles all add to the atmosphere of you being inside of a haunted house. Listening to the ghost hunt you down and their feet stomping behind you gives you a rush and is a wonderful experience

The price: 15$ CAD for this game is a steal, I am glad the developers priced it as so as it helped encourage me and my friend group to buy it.

The lobby has some good distractions such as can stacking and basketball.

Constant updates: This can't be understated the developers for this game are pumping out bug fixes and mini updates and i'm glad they are keeping the content flowing.

Cons:
Audio glitches: Some levels start with members not being able to hear everybody else, it is normally 1 player not being heard, or 1-2 players not being able to hear others. Re launching the lobby often fixes this glitch.

Render glitches: Large maps can sometimes cause item tearing on items that are freshly rendered into the game. This may be an issue with my GPU being too weak.

Missing rewards and items: In multiplayer matches the players that aren't host can occasionally miss the reward for finding the correct ghost type. Items that we bring in sometimes don't appear with us in the van, other times leaving levels makes us lose items. Our group is consistent with bringing everything we brought in to the level back to the van. This increases immersion for us and we are aware that dying looses the players items. 

Sometimes the ghost is a little b*tch: On small levels with 4 players we can be chanting the ghosts name in every room just waiting for the first response. This can lead to us waiting in every room for sometimes upwards of 15 minuets before seeing any evidence. 

Game storage: The game stores the game locally on your PC so if you are going to switch to your laptop or other PC make sure you transfer your save data. This may become an issue for cheating as it will be easier for players to abuse cheat engine if the files are stored locally.

Recommendations:
Allow player modding.
Allow PC players to hold active items on their belt similar to VR players.
Allow players to view controls in the level.
Allow players to open the journal in the lobby.
Candles can be formed in a pentagram so summon a demon or trigger a ghost event.
An item that triggers a ghost attack on the item and can be used to distract certain ghosts.
Houses that have no ghost.
Rats and crows that make large shadows on the walls and make sounds.
A sound system in the high school the ghost can use to taunt the players.
A record players or music box the ghost can mess with in the house.
An outdoor graveyard or trailer park level that has you walking between buildings.
A ghost that takes the form of an animal such as a dog.
In higher difficulties make it mandatory to bring all of your items back to the van or risk losing them.
Possible support for 6 players on large maps.

This game is honestly very impressive. The AI seems frighteningly intelligent at times, resulting in interesting and satisfying gameplay. The variety is also incredible, making for immense replayability. There are a reasonable amount of maps, but each one has many different locations in which activity may be focused. This, paired with 10 different types of ghosts means that no two matches will be the same. 
I think the best way to convey why this game is so excellent is to present a few of my most interesting situations...

-Hiding in a locker while a demon is on the hunt, hoping it won't hear my team yelling "Are you alive?" over my radio.
-Walking into a house and being scared out by footsteps running towards me not five seconds after stepping inside.
-Asking, over my mic, "Where are you?" and hearing "next... right next..." over the spirit box before a shadow walked out of the wall next to me.
-Watching my friend walk into a room and then realizing something followed him in only feet behind him after a footstep appeared in the salt he had dropped.

The fact that Phasmophobia is able to deliver this kind of gameplay, completely unscripted, is remarkable. Multiplayer horror games don't usually stay scary when you've got four people working together, but this one almost always does. 

I cannot recommend this game enough, I think it is more than worth the price, and I can't wait to keep playing.

God this game is terrifying. The environments are great and the way you identify ghosts is fun. I've found EMF 5 and Freezing Temperature ghosts are the easiest to discover, but that doesn't make them any more terrifying. Playing by yourself is...scary. Playing with friends is an amazing shared experience of pure terror.

My only issues with the game are the bugs (like crashes, ghosts not spawning) and the rate you earn money is so slow compared to how fast you can spend it.

Also, this game lets you play both in AND out of VR. I have VR so I can't wait to not try this game in it! Not because its broken but because I'm scared to.

This game is a surprise hit between me and my friends. The fear is more of a slow burn very little to no jumpscares you don't realize you're feeling the terror until it is too late and the ghost is already hunting you. 

The game gives you a lot of entertainment for the price point, I think it is well worth the money and you will keep coming back for more horror. Yes it is rough around the edges but the developers so far have been vigilant with the updates and responding to the community.

I do not regret purchasing this game at all.

Apologize in advance if my review is all over the place, but...most of my reviews are lol.

Anyways, this game is truly an experience. I hate scary stuff but like it at the same time. It's the thrill. Most of the time, I just stop playing cuz I'm too scared to keep going. A friend of mine recommended me this game and I thought I check it out. I did some research and seen some videos. Some of it was crazy, some of it spooky, and outright at times funny to see these peoples' reactions. I've seen some episodes on tv about ghost hunting and paranormal stuff and all. However, taking that niche and putting it into a game was ballsy. You can now try and experience what it's like to chase after ghosts. It's a 4 player coop but you can also brave it alone if you choose to do so. After playing for a couple of hours, I'd say this is probably one of my favorite games so far. The atmosphere is what makes the game, you don't know what to expect. It's different experience every game especially if you play with randoms or your friends. Yeah it's early access and all and might be just a little rough around the edges, but this game has super potential and I'm really having lots of fun and I normally don't say that about games I'm too scared to play lol. I don't want to get into depth about the game as its something you have to experience yourself. And for 14 bucks? Rooobust.

This game has tons of potential and updates to work with. It is still in early access.

Issue: The tutorial I feel could be way better. My friend joined for the first time and literally did not know what to do. He had to be told by his chat on stream how to play. Other than that, I don't see a way for this games tutorial to actually help you except save you some time by starting the training and immediately quitting out, alt tab to a Youtube game play and learn that way.

In Game Issue: My friend literally can juke the ghost mid hunt by running around a couch while he's being chased.

Thoughts and Feedback: It can only be more immersed in its interactions. Instead of activating the ghost instantly, fade in and fade out the ghosts.. Make objects float. Sometimes the ghost appearing and standing there for a couple of seconds breaks the immersion because my friends and I are teasing it and making fun of it. This game is scary, not because of jumpscares but by the ambience created. Creaking sounds, knocks, steps and what not. Gives anyone anxiety. So I would say, just make it more immersed.

Also add rotating cameras with 60 to 70 degree vision cone.

Well.... my first game was with random people.
We chose the school as the map. (one of the biggest maps in the game, frikn huge! aaand nobody had ever played htat map either....)
When we finally loaded in, we were only two people.... the others had disconnected during loading...
But we wanted to try anyway!
This one guy that loaded in with me went on to be my beginners mentor basicly, tought me everything i needed to know.
After walking around the school for 20-30 minutes without finding anything, our lights start to flicker.
We emidiatly run inside a classroom, we close the door and stay silent as a mouse.
2-3 seconds after we close the door, we hear the ghost walk right outside it. It stops, for a while before vanishing.
After that, the ghost attacks happens every other minute, but we still can't find the damn source. 
So we grow tired and our smart asses decides to not give a fu** and charge the motherfu**er. 
This ends by me getting my neck snapped and my mentor running as fast as he can back to the van while saying calmly to himself: "Fu** this, i'm out. Fu** this i'm out. Fu** this i'm out" until he reaches the van and gets out:)

10/10, i can't wait to play more!

After 10 hours of screaming and fun experiences so far, I have already recommended this game to anyone who'd listened! If you love horror games, just get it already. If you're on the fence, it's an extremely fun experience with friends (especially given the price), even if you find yourself doing "van duty". 

On that note, if you get stressed easily in horror games, being in the van and helping your braver ghost hunters navigate the maps (especially the larger ones) is a great way to experience the game without throwing yourself in the haunted landscape directly. I've seen plenty of paranormal events (as well as my friends -almost- dying) simply from investigating via video/head cameras. Because of this along other features, I don't feel like I've lost much of the game experience. So, to my fellow anxious horror lovers, give it a shot!

I do predict that the game will receive a bit of polishing as bugs show up, and I've only experienced one glitch so far (the $0 menu one, which was already fixed recently!) I look forward to seeing how this game grows, and hope that the map might eventually cover other regions around the globe (as well as more ghost types) to spice things up in future updates!

It's a good mix of different minds investigating the same problems. I highly recommend this game, especially if you have others to play it with.

Think Ghost Hunters style with ESP device things and cctv cameras around a dark house. A standout feature is the voice recognition, saying the ghost name will piss it off and it will start to act up. It is pretty unique and I can not wait for what the devs add.

Seriously one of the scariest games I've ever played in all my life of horror games, and jump scares. The fact that sometimes nothing at all happens is more scarier than things actually taking place. Other games rely on cheap jump jump scares to make you scream, and terrify you, but this game? This game doesn't need any of that. You know you're heading into a haunted house, you know there is a ghost in there, but you don't know if it's going to kill you or not. The fact you can jump in with three other friends is amazing too to share in all the scares, and thrills. I've had one really good scream in this game so far, and I except I'll be getting many more out of it as time goes on. It's only EA, but the game feels amazing to play, and the leveling system feels great in terms of progression, and upgrades. 

TLDR: 12/10 horror game, will scream again with friends listening to me crying how scared I am that I don't want to go back inside of the house.

TL;DR: A Truly Unique, Insanely Effective Multiplayer Horror Game With Infinite Replayability Filled With Consistent Fun and Spooky Atmosphere Without All The Jumpscares That So Many Other Horror Games Fall Into. 10/10.
 
I love this game and it's going to blow up. This is one of my absolute favorite video games and I cannot get enough of it. The developer keeps the game updated frequently and the love that is put into it shows. I love the idea of playing a horror game with my friends and being a paranormal investigator with them is fantastic. We are all searching for the unknown with some basic equipment.

The atmosphere is simply the best! It plays a very muted and consistent baseline for whenever you enter a house and brings an innate sense of dread just being in there. A feeling that you are not welcomed and that you do not belong there is all done with the room layouts and the sounds. The sounds and lighting bring out the uneasy feelings that remain consistent as you walk through the houses, asylum, or school. 

Going into any location will immediately start making goosebumps show up and the hairs stand up. One of the most important aspects of this game is it's lack of jumpscares. This game barely has any because the ghost uses sounds and lights, sometimes an occasional object thrown or a brief appearance from the ghost, but not directly hiding behind a corner waiting for you to trigger it's "jumpscare events." The lack of jumpscares makes this game more authentically dreadful.

I got this game just a three days after release and I have not stopped playing this game in my free time. I have been telling all of my friends about it and following the Discord page and even writing my first game review for it because I love this game so much. This game is a gem and it's only going to keep getting better. It would not surprise me if this game blows up and becomes available on all consoles.  What I'm saying is: get it, keep it, and get some sp0ooky in your life.

This game is. It's kind of broken. It has some issues. Thankfully the majority of those issues appear in places where you won't fucking brutally die because of them.

Now. Onto the game. It's oddly immersive, despite how it may look graphically. And it's... Scary, anxiety inducing, gripping your controllers tight, positioning your tongue so you don't bite it off scary. Not. AHHH! and then AHHHHH! and then AH, and then, ahh!? followed by some 'here it comes, oh no ahhh' scary. Every moment. Every second. Things could go very bad, very fast, but it doesn't. And it doesn't. And then it does.

If you like scary with a sprinkle or two of jump scares maybe not even once a game, then try this out. If you like puzzles and figuring things out. Try this out. If you don't get scared easily and have some big chungus balls, try this out because you're probably going to be forced to die as you find out all your friends are pizz babies. (Hi that's me.) Yes you can play this on desktop. Yes it works. No it's not the same game. They do a wonderful job of utilizing the headset and immersing you, the sounds, the lights, everything. Seriously, if you have some friends, give it a peek, you'll find out in an hour or two if you want to return it, easily.

This is 100% the best horror game in VR. It doesn't rely on jumpscares, it's just the ghosts talking to you or slamming doors and the chilling atmosphere. It has a few bugs like when you just cant hear your team: their audio is just gone. Or when some clipping things are done wrong like the van exit: you can get stuck on the ramp. Just minor things, this game is really good none the less!

Cons would be it doesn't control the greatest on the index so far, it looks like it was made for the vive; i'm waiting for an update for other vr controller to make it better. The slider on the index and the right joystick control the rotation so you cant rest your hand on it. Everytime you snap turn your screen will go blackish, (doesnt happen with smooth turn) and it is just bit unpleasent. You will also have to change the X Y & Z axis of the controllers so it matches your hand positions.

All of this will most likely be fixed or added in due time! 

But this game is actually really good! I haven't found many other VR players in this, it's mainly been PC users. But i really enjoy how this game plays!

OVERALL

Wow, yeah, this is a ton of fun. Playing solo was a little too stressful in VR, since I'm a chicken shit but once I got some friends to join, it was way easier. It's a very immersive experience that will leave you wanting to explore another house and figure out which kind of spirit is inside. It's worth more than they're asking for it, even in early access. We only encountered one persistent bug in the few hours we've played so far, and it's an issue with the equipment loading in at the start of a match. It's fixed by relaunching the lobby. There are a few texture/item pop-in bugs as well but it's not super distracting. Definitely recommended, even if you're not a fan of horror games since there's such an emphasis on investigation and teamwork.

[h1]( Played in VR on oculus rift S ) Got all clues, was on my way to get out when i heard a breath in my right ear, started to panic, the ghost appeared right next to me, didn't sleep that night. 10/10 would play again[/h1]

More seriously, the game is good, really good. Especially for an early access game, honestly you can barely tell it's early access as it feels like a full release.

Keep in mind that all the pros and cons i'm gonna write are for my VR experience only as i haven't tried the game in flatscreen mode.

[h1]Pros[/h1]
[list]
[*]The graphics are good enough to be immersed
[*]The sound design is crazy good, it's definitely one of the best parts of the game and it's one of my favorite if not my favorite sound design in any horror game i've played ( and i've played a lot ).
[*]The gameplay loop is fun and challenging
[*]There is a lot of replayability as there is a level system, daily tasks and the situations are randomized
[*]You can play with your flatscreen friends even when you're playing in VR
[*]There is a lot of gadgets and almost all of them have their utility
[*]It's. Damn. Scary.
[*]The different ghosts all have their gimmicks and "personality"
[*]The game runs really well on my setup ( details on my setup down bellow )
[*]The voice recognition mechanic is really fun
[*]Creating a lobby and joining your friends works flawlessly, even though i'd have liked to have a "join game" option in steam but hey, a 6 digits code isn't much to copy
[/list] 

[h1]Cons[/h1]
[list]
[*]You character is slow, like really really slow and you can't run. I know it's a choice by the devs but f*ck, when someone dies in front of you or a ghost is chasing you anyone would run...
[*]The door openings mechanics are not very intuitive
[*]In some places when you crouch the item is too low to be picked up, it's under the "real life floor", i'd have said that this is a problem in my vr config but every other game works fine in that regard and some places in the game don't have that problem like the hub so it's probably an issue in the game itself.
[*]There is a lot of vr glitches, you can pass through doors and walls in some maps ( not gonna lie it allowed me to not sh*t myself in some places but it's still a bug )
[/list]

I'd recommend this game to everyone, horror fan or not because the mechanics are really fun and surprisingly deep.

(I had posted a review before but had decided to give it a few more days before judging it and removed it since then the issues i had were fixed. The mechanics of the game work like a charm now and I barely have any problems with the voip.)
       
  Now on to the actual review part of the review. The sound design in this game is superb the locations have the ambiance that you would expect the floor creaks you can hear the rustling of trees or the sound of your footsteps on the ground all lend itself to the atmosphere that the game creates for you. 

      The gameplay for the most part this has been pretty good with all of the ghost items giving you enough clues to understand what it is you are supposed to be doing. 

        The visuals while lacking i think in combination with the sound design and the gameplay makes this a truly horrific experience to deal with on your own 

           Cooperative play:This is for me where the game thrives it's tense and scary playing by yourself but where the game shines in it's social activity in which three of your friends are going to be screaming at the ghost which one would think would detract from the experience but the sheer terror that is generated when you hear your friend scream cut short is far above anything i've encountered in single player

            The bad bits: as much as i love this game there needs to be one thing made clear this game is buggy and sometimes this messes with how the game behaves and with certain bugs can make a great game into a frustrating one and in my 20 hours i have encountered many bugs that have ruined the otherwise great game but i should also note i am willing to wait to see what this game will become so overall I would say buy this game if you like shows like ghost adventures or just want to hunt some ghosts with your panicked friends this game is fun for everyone.

On September 24, 2020, Phil Rossi invited me to join him in an early release of this game, Phasmophobia, from Kinetic Games. This is a co-op survival game, available on PC and VR-ready, where up to four people team up to investigate a haunting and identify the ghost. As this is a survival game and very much of the horror genre, things go wrong. Quickly.

And at https://youtu.be/LQaeQxJ3zqY is a highlight reel of that night. What. A. Bonkers. Ride.

Phil and I will be returning to this new release at https://twitch.tv/philrossimedia and https://twitch.tv/theteemonster on Thursday nights, at 10:30pm ET.

Headphones on. Lights off.

ORIGINAL:
Do I enjoy this game? Yes
Could I recomend it in its current state? Fuck no.
Constant bugs, glitches, and general pain in the ass features make the game a test of frustration more than it is a horror game; 
A list of issues I've encountered thus far;
A group of three of us CANNOT play together; host or one of the players crash every time we try to launch; no reason given, can play in groups of two with every other player, when the third player tries to join, total game failure.
Audio bugs; players can't hear me, I can't hear players in game. really Ruins the immersion when you have to swap to discord. 
MORE Audio bugs; Spirit box outright not understanding you no matter how clear you say the words
Misleading features; ghosts that exhibit certain traits not exhibiting said traits; for example, freezing temperature and use of the spirit box not showing up, making it impossible to determine what ghost you're dealing with. 
And to top that all off, why the everloving hell would you tie a core game feature to the user REQUIRING windows 10 to play? Don't you think that limits your playerbase a bit?!
All in all; I enjoy the game, but the frustrations make it so I cannot with sound mind reccomend it to a friend.
REVISION 1:
As I said to friends; I'd review this comment whenever changes were made. To my surprise they have!
Most of the games bugs are either being worked on, fixed, or in generally at least noticed by the development team. 
In general the development team have been proactive in that the bugs I've listed are mostly gone; misleading features is still an issue, I still have issues with the Spirit box and my accent, And I have since had a few... Visual bugs to say the least.
However! The gamebreaking stuff HAS been addressed, much to my excitement, and I can happily change this review to a positive one in light of that. Still think they should move away from using the inbuilt system, and make their own, thank you by the way @SeveredSkullz for letting me know that was a thing.

Ive been playing with my friends ( Funsfun and Juwuki ) this game is so fun. Incredibly interesting topic, and its a horror game you can feel yourself getting good at without it losing charm quickly.

Its got a learning curve though and while it is fun to learn I think its best played with friends.
Some tips:
- You don't need to collect all your equipment before surviving, if you survive you get it all back.
- Sometimes you don't get all 3 evidence, so get some then base it off their behavior.
- Use a crucifix in front of a room your pretty sure is the ghost room it should lock them down mostly (careful though theyre limited to only 2 uses now).
- Buy photo cameras so you can photograph more evidence, photograph everything, fingerprints, interactions, bones, the ghost if you can. It all gives you more money.
- In bigger maps rotate out a camera jockey who shot calls sanity, ghost interaction levels, and can search ghost orbs.
- If your flashlight and all lights are flickering, the exit door will lock so hide, either in a different room or a closet.
- Smudge sticks will delay the hunt allowing you to hide with a time period bigger than 5 seconds.
- 1-2 activity ghost is interacting or moving 4 activity ghost likely sees you or hears you 6-7 activity it shows its presence 10 activity is a hunt.
- Calling the ghosts name from the truck can still cause activity to spike so be careful of reminding your friends of the name, could accidentally initiate a hunt.
- Also the most fun experience is with a mic, but keep in mind the ghost is listening. if you've ever watched a paranormal show just use some of the common phrases you hear from that and youll likely get a reaction.
- Spirit box worst item, straight up so finnicky. best of luck getting it to work.
- Salt best item, helps determine location and makes locking down position much easier. <3

Seriously I'm just kinda learning as I go but its very fun. consider giving it a try.

One of the best co-op horror games out there. Once you learn the game it becomes relatively easy objective wise, but the whole point of the game isn't about just rushing objectives and winning, it's about immersing yourself in the environment and letting yourself be scared, and that's where the game [i]shines[/i].

There are about 7 maps, 12 ghost types, a bunch of equipment, and objectives that very each mission, making the game feel refreshing and replayable. No two rounds will feel the same. Aside from a few bugs with items (currently voice chat is a bit shaky with it's detection but they're actively working on fixes), everything works well and has a strong purpose.

If you've got a couple friends that feel like having constant adrenaline rushes from the slightest things like a cup falling off a table or doors slamming shut, then get the game and get ready to get scared. The atmosphere alone is top notch.

They got a real good base gameplay idea to expand from.

The goal in the game is currently to find out which type of ghost is haunting a location. To do so, you have access to a bunch of equipment that helps you find in which room the ghost lives, and his properties. There are also side quests you can do to make more money. Money buys more equipment.

Each mission is randomly generated with a location (House, Cabin in the Woods, Asylum, School) (with more to come like Manor, Prison, Apartment on their roadmap). The ghost will be randomly located in one of the rooms, and be randomly selected from a list of 12 ghost types.

This has been really fun, me and my buddies try to become better ghost hunters and learn how each ghost reacts, and how each equipment work. It's not been easy as there are bugs with this Early Access title, sometimes equipment does not work properly.

The lights flickered and the door locked behind me, a screaming child ran down the stairs and tore my body to shreds in front of my friends.

I've been searching for years after a good coop horror game, that does not live on jumpscares and is a genuine cooperative experience. I never imagined something like this, and this game is by far the best horror game i have ever played or seen.

How is the game? Well, did you ever watch those "Ghost Hunters" on Discovery channel? Well, that's exactly what you can expect.

This is definitely Early Access as there are still a lot of issues that need to be iron'd out.

So what is "Phasmophobia" it's essentially a ghost hunters game. You got locations and hunt ghosts (10 different ones to be exact) each ghost has particular set of skills, strengths, weaknesses and traits. You need to plan, and prepare at all times.

This game can also be played in VR. 

While the locations maybe limited; there is still a whole lot of content here for just 10 ghosts which is nuts. There's a level system, dailies and check this out "full voice recognition" meaning you can actually use your voice to talk to ghosts with certain phrases - pretty cool right? well while the price point is legit; there are indeed some issues. Like for example, sometimes the ghost does not really respond to the spirit box - maybe it's because the voice isn't all that great OR if you are using group chat like Discord it prefers in-game; or maybe your not saying the correct phrase clearly and correctly? I don't know really; Funny thing is that you can still use push to talk and hear just fine. Either way this issue needs to be looked at because it ain't fun when 99.99% of the time it's just guessing from very little evidence.

Besides the voice issues. There are three things to bare in mind especially a particular issue....

1) Not every match is obviously the same. You must think careful what to purchase BEFORE proceeding onto the case because holy heck it can be a make it or break it if your not prepared; Hopefully maybe somewhere down the line a patch will be made for a small margin of chance.

2) You earn money for every Ghost haunting you solve correctly AND completing objectives and bonuses that may come along with it. And of course, there is a leveling system if you haven't figured it out already and in order to level up you must solve the cases correctly and complete objectives, etc. As i stated before

3) Very little accessibility options for the disable gamer. So if you are a disable gamer, and you really want to play this game; be aware there is very little room for fairness. There is no dialogue option choice when using the spirit box or call-out commands like in a Call of Duty game or R6: Siege. Everything must be done clear, concise through voice chat. Hopefully the developers will add this option somewhere down the line.

Overall for $14 it's a damn good 4 player co-op horror game. While the maps are limited, there are plenty of ghosts; and while there are dailies and potential whacky moments to be had; the voice issues, plus the three things that i have listed can be a make it or break it; especially at $14.

=====VIRTUAL REALITY REVIEW=====
(Early access review made on 28 of september 2020)
I really think that's one of the best vr titles(at least for the horror genre). It brings the full potential of VR in most scenarios and immerses you in a spooky environment. It shines in some sides but gets a little buggy and immerse breaking in other(You have to give them a break for being a early access title).
++++PROS++++
-I really think all environments all really well polished with a good vibe in it. You will really feel you are entering a ghosted place with someone looking after you in each corner.
-The game mechanics are really great, it it a game you want to explore even if you are sh*ting your pants. (Almost) All tools feel useful and serve a purpose in the game world, you keep getting in doubt to what take with you and spend a good time in a "planning" phase.
-The character models are in an acceptable level of detail and the sites you go hunt have a good/above average graphics.

-----CONS-----
-The game still needs some performance fixes to get to it's full potential.
-It lacks some "Must Haves" VR features in 2020. Your hand is not in the same angle than your real hand is, the characters hand are always of the first character, even if you change it, the character doesn't closes it hand on grab, the index controller have no finger tracking(This last one is still common tbh).

Only just picked this up today, and I can certainly tell you that if you play in VR, then you will have a hell of a time (pun intended if you would like).

After some convincing, my two friends got me to play, and we loaded up our first game. Needless to say, being the spineless gay I already am, I made it as far as the living room while my friends made their way to the basement to set up a camera (after arguing with me to open the door first). After that, we made our way to the garage and saw the lights flicker rapidly. We all huddled into the laundry room until the lights were killed, and I suddenly had fingers wrapped around my eyes. Props to the devs for adding yet another feminine trait to my personality: the ear piercing screams of a high school girl. Despite the traumatizing experience of having a little man with no face rip my eyes out as my friends yelled incoherently, I'm going to keep playing this because this is the most immersive experience I've ever had in VR. Once again, cheers to the devs for making a great horror game. I look forward to seeing what more the devs will add, and definitely recommend this to people looking for a good co-op horror game.

Although relatively bare bones at the moment, this game has fantastic potential. As it stands at the time of this review, the game is extremely fun to play, whether solo or with friends. The general gameplay loop is simple and entertaining and the spooks are certainly to be had. Quite a few bugs still but the dev is extremely active which gives me high hopes for this game's future. 100% recommend.

There's a reason why my friends and I lovingly refer to this game as "The Spooky Dookie Maker".

This game has a great atmosphere and interactions that set in genuine fear. The gameplay is somewhat challenging but straightforward in such a way that it asks you ride a fine line between cautious discovery and getting your neck snapped. Its clever use of voice recognition and proximity chat cannot be understated and hearing my friends say "well, it's got me, goodnight!" has got to be the most harrowing but hilarious sh*t ever. 

For a game in early access, it's one of the most fun horror titles I've played in a while. 

With that, it is a game in early access and isn't entirely bug free or without some flaws. One time on one of the townhouse levels, my friend dropped an EMF reader and it disappeared through the floorboards of the porch. The levels, while varied and randomly generated, tend to blend together after a while because of the similarities that they have in both objectives and in design. 

Those are some of my opinions of the game and while I have some things to say against the quality of the title, they're purely my opinions and I don't think that your money or time should be misplaced because of how I said one or two negative things.

Horrifying with intricate design, Phasmophobia pushes the boundaries of the horror genre somewhat with its premise of ghost hunting and deduction for the purposes of expelling them from haunted locations. All of the ghosts have their own traits and hallmarks, as well as how aggressive they are and what kinds of things they can interact with; the whole process leaves you feeling unwelcome and with the possibility of being hunted down and killed by said spirits you'll have to really poke and prod to get the information you need and get out alive.

Phasmophobia's design is intricate in the sense that it uses your microphone for speech recognition the entire time - while it is rather rudimentary how many phrases the spirits can understand, the game uses it perfectly to make the ghost interact with the location you're in and as well as to reply to your questions whether through regular dialogue or through specialised tools like the Ghost Box, and with the ghosts having their own "hunting phase" saying too much while it is active could lead to your untimely demise.

Multiplayer is...rough around the edges, but it works mostly as much as it needs to which is quite a plus considering the ambition on display here from but a single developer. Some ghosts will reply to everyone in the room, whereas others will only reply to people on their own - in fact ghosts hunt differently depending on the amount of players in close proximity so there's no real set "strat" to handling a hunt when other people are involved, and when the radio stops working and your flashlight starts clicking which causes you to lose contact with the boys that's when the genuine fear begins to set in.
Its cool and fun with friends. Only suggestion is keep adding more.
An intense experience, genuine fun with friends.

I love the type of fear I get from this game. Before I go into further detail, I'm playing in VR, so I don't have the desktop experience. It doesn't try to get you with cheap thrills like jumpscares, loud banging noises, or screams, it uses the atmosphere of each map. It's not the game itself that makes you scared, it's your own mind, the anticipation that something might happen, the fear of the unknown since there isn't just one model for the ghost or one place the ghost always appears. It's that uncertainty that gets your heart pumping and makes you scared to continue. Some ghosts don't give a damn if you're around others, and will haunt regardless, but others will wait till you're alone, and the latter REALLY gets into your head and causes you to try to delegate one of your friends to performing tasks. Playing with friends is super fun, and gives you more of a sense of "No one gets left behind", but I believe that playing with 3 random others could still be an amazing time since there is voice chat/recognition in-game.

TL;DR: It may be Early Access, but give it a shot. The experience is worthwhile and the fear you feel will be genuine rather than artificial.
IF you hear breathing and a thump sound find a closet to hide in ASAP.

Not being a person that is easily scared from horror games or particularly enjoys them as I often find them tedious and boring (to this day i still haven't beaten Alien isolation, not because it's scary, but because i find the alien is more annoying than scary and impedes my progress), I wasn't too interested in this. But a friend of mine told me it has VR support and that it was $14 and CO-OP. so i thought, "eh, why not?" Bought it and strapped in.

And holy shit. First house me and my mate did, we both opened the front door and we both collectively went "fuck that." then went back and forth on who goes first. Being in VR dramatically changes the tone of the game. I was constantly on high-alert. I turned to look behind me at some point and screamed like a little girl because i saw one of the ghosts just staring at me before quickly disappearing. 

It was at that point, that I knew that this game was worth the $14. It scared the absolute living shit outta me multiple-times when none of the other horror VR games could.

I highly recommend buying this so long as you own VR. I haven't played pancake mode yet, but i cannot begin to even think it amounts to the same level as VR-mode does.

SO, I'm going to tell you a event I got in this game. Please read if you wanna know what you're getting into here. (20 hours at time of this review)

My friends and I had few runs and I got 2 of my friends to buy the game, they skipped the tutorial and we did not get tanglewood as a map so I took them to the street house instead since I think it is the 2nd smallest map in the game. I opted to be van guy since I had most of the gear and did not want to die to a demon so I sent the 3 poor souls into the house with everything they need and I introduced them to their equipment,

During the first 5 minutes I walked in and placed a camera in my favorite spot, in the kitchen facing the piano/dining room. I then set one upstairs, some motion/sound/infrared even salt downstairs with glow sticks to check for prints, I then got cozy in my truck and sat there with the radio telling the crew if I see anything on sound/motion and if they see an infrared go off.

After flicking through getting nothing I asked if they had anything, someone asked me if I was downstairs because he heard something, I told him no and I checked the activity level and it was at 2 so it was pretty low and I didn't think much of it, I flicked through to the camera I was talking about and I saw this silhouette of a girl standing in the corner the wall outside the piano room, sitting in the darkness. Staring into my camera at a distance. I was speechless that a unity game could make me feel this unsafe from the truck, I didn't move, I stared at it and it stared back at me, after a few minutes it vanished and I saw my friend come into the room. I have never seen an event like that again out of my 20 hours of playing this game.

This game is exactly what I, and many others have been waiting for.

Terrifying ambiance? Done.
Terrifying enemies? Done.
Voice communication and voice recognition? Done.
Co-op/cross platform (with VR)? Done.
Variety that drifts from the cookie cutter jump-scare garbage? Done.
A sense of stress and suspense that hasn't been felt since Alien Isolation? Done.
Fun with friends while also experiencing the horror together? Done.

This game is the best experience for you as a solo player or with friends. Take up to 4 people and work together to find out what exactly is haunting these suburban households and rural farms. 


Edit: the recent update making leveling easier was a blessing from the gods.
Especially because this is in early access, I see unlimited potential for this title. The maps are stunning and really set the tone for the investigation to come. Eerie door opening leads to you biting your nails hoping there isn't a deadly ghoul on the other side. Lights flickering and paranoia combined with the shrieking of banshees and mares will have you checking your closet before bed. 

Keep in mind, this is all coming from someone who has only played keyboard and mouse. If you have a VR headset, this game is a must buy. 10/10 in the horror, fun, and content. 

Haunting's are always different and will have you on your toes the entire session. You will never see the same kind of ghost in the same room doing the same effects/events twice. There is so much randomness to the maps and enemies that it creates a sense of controlled chaos that is very, very hard to control. You may think you have the ghost figured out, but something may happen on a camera that changes your entire theory making you start from almost square one.

I must warn those who think they will walk into this game knowing everything, there is a HUGE learning curve. If you fail, and you will, try again. Even with no friends to play this game, there are plenty of servers to join and people to meet. As long as this game is supported by the devs and the community, it will be around for a long time to come along with it's player base.

One gripe I have with the game is the menu's though. Other than that, this game has a lot of potential.

Also just a quick addition, being able to call a ghosts name through your mic and having them respond using the map is the coolest thing I've seen all 2020. Amazing/10
