This is a wonderful surprise. A ghost hunting themed 4 player early access title that works really well and is very reasonably priced and it's not one of those streamer bait games.

I play on desktop and it's creepy as hell. People on VR I've played with lose their shit at times. I can't even imagine.

There's a fixed amount of sites but between the different types of ghosts and ways you can collect evidence on them it doesn't get stale so far. There's light progression that helps as well.

Ghosts range from shy troublemakers to murderous demons that will slam the doors, lock you or your unfortunate buddy in, and kill you. 

It's pretty nuts to be investigating a room, have the lights flicker prompting people to leave the room and before the last person gets out it shuts and locks. When it opens again your buddy is dead.

You'll get your money worth for sure and hopefully there's more to come.

Great game! Well put together, but VR controls (better and more immersive gameplay) are still a little buggy. Hard to pick up items on the floor or flip light switches as of this post. Highly recommend!

Awesome game! I had to walk into a house to face a ghost alone while my friends watched from a camera and I can't express how my heart was racing. Fantastic experience, I'm going to have to buy my friend a copy to play the game with him.

Pros: This game is pretty sick. The atmosphere is pretty on point and the investigatory nature of the game is pretty great. I really liked the gameplay loop and the co-op was very fun. If you're considering getting it to play with some friends, absolutely go for it. There is a pretty neat selection of ghosts to hunt down. Each has an entry in your journal detailing their strengths and weaknesses as well as what signs show'll show on the physical world.

Cons: The animations are a little strange, but it's basically a non-issue. You also lose all of your purchased items when you die, which I would really prefer didn't happen: I bought flashlights for the other three people I was playing with, but I died and they lost those flashlights even though they survived. It's very frustrating that not everyone gets a flashlight. There's also a bug where items are un-pickupable from dead bodies, so if they had items necessary for the investigation, you might be locked out of those clues and forced to guess.

I think this game has A LOT of potentioal, because it's based on such rich features like voice recognition , ai based horror and VR inetracted envoirment. i really enjoyed the gameplay and idea with these couple of hours gameplay , but i know for sure , if handled well by the devs this game can improve A LOT better and possibly one day become the best co-op Horror game in the market.
also i heard this game made by only 1 individual indie programmer (?) i gotta admit this game in this early access state, is MUCH better than lots of other horror games already in the market which is even created by a whole squad.
i really wish they keep up with the updates and improve the game , i really really loved this brilliant idea , i totally recommend this game !
Great game so far. Definitely an interesting take on horror (instead of just being there for the scare, you're being more of a ghost detective). Would recommend with friends.

For an early access game, this was VERY well made! Immersion is obviously better in VR but I still choose to play on my desktop from time to time because it is equally as fun.

The amount of content to explore is not SUPER high for an older game, but it's more than anyone could ask for in an early access game.

PROS:
- Loads of fun, especially with friends
- Immersive
- Fair amount of content
- Amazing VR visuals
- Can interact with most objects in VR

CONS:
- Some visual glitches in room corners and edges
- Tool belt will stop syncing with VR sometimes (it comes back after a few seconds)
- VR controls can feel wonky and are pretty sensitive

Overall, this is an amazing game for only being out for about a week. Huge props do the dev team and I cannot wait to see what else is coming!

Picked this up after watching burkeblack, bikeman, and the rest of the late shift play it. This is a very good game. After the tutorial...which creeped me out, I ran a solo investigation. It was at the farmhouse. I'm 37 and have been gaming my whole life. This game scared me like when I was a teenager playing the Clock Tower game. I went into the farmhouse and pulled out my spirit box and started asking questions. I determined the ghost was creeping around dining room/living room since it answered me on the spirit box. Then it hit a key on the piano. I setup a video camera in the corner facing the piano. Then the phone that was off the hook started to ring. I pulled out my emf meter out and it maxed out. My heart really started beating at that point. Then, I heard the kitchen door open behind me. I turned around and pointed my flashlight towards the door. Didn't see anything. I walked through the door and started scanning the room with my flashlight. In the far corner of the kitchen I saw a dark figured ghost carrying an axe and it started walking towards me. I screamed out loud "O hell no!" Turned around and headed straight outside back to the van. Got to the van and realized I left the camera in the dining room when I looked at the computer and it showed the view my camera I had in the room. There was a bottle rolling across the floor on the screen. I yelled at myself for leaving the camera. I had to go back for it. So I went back in as fast as possible and grabbed that camera and as I got to the door to leave again i could hear the ghost running right behind me shrieking. I got in the van and plugged my evidence into the journal and did a lil deducing and realized I was dealing with a jinn. I hit the button to close the van door and I was off. Mission accomplished. It was so creepy and fun that I gifted a copy to my 11yr old son, so him and I can do some ghost hunting. Can't wait to play with him this weekend. I highly recommend this game. It's a steal at 13 bucks, and has a great foundation for lots of content updates in the future
Like nothing else I've played before.

Starting off by saying I play in VR and can't speak for the desktop version. Amazing horror experience, This game makes you feel like you got dropped into the middle of an Insidious movie. 12 hours into the game and every encounter still feels exciting. There aren't really any jump scares that were made to be jump scares, just atmospheric horror, creepy situations, and unsettling events; this makes the game feel very immersive and even more frightening.

There are some major bugs but that's expected in early access and I trust that they'll be mostly fixed in the future. I believe there are currently 5-6 houses, a school (which is huge), and an asylum (which is absolutely massive). You never know what will happen at each location or where in the location it will happen. Playing with friends is definitely recommended but not required.

If you have VR and enjoy horror games this should definitely be something you consider picking up.

Phasmophobia is a ghost investigation game and it’s well done for EA. There are some minor bugs but not too bad. It has great replay ability because there’s 10 different ghost and a bunch of maps you can play on, I played for like 7 hours straight and only got off because of my controllers. It leans towards VR players but desktop players can still play. Three of my buddies are desktop and they don’t have many complaints. The coolest thing about this game is the voice recognition. You can ask the spirit questions and sometimes it’ll answer. Games honestly a steal with the price right now, and it’s super fun with the boys. I strongly recommend!

One of the models bugged during my game, the child one, and it stretched the neck out way longer and made the face small and featureless. I haven't gotten too far into this game, but so far I absolutely love it. The atmosphere is creepy as hell. There were moments that gave me legit goosebumps. I played with a friend and we were both hesitant to go back inside the house after ghost interactions that freaked us out. 

In VR this game is incredibly immersive and will freak you out as you're roaming around these haunted locations. We found ourselves rushing out of the house after a freaky encounter with a ghost that left us shook. lol There was one moment when we were in the single story home and we were investigating the living room when all of the sudden I heard what sounded like an exhale/gasp/breath across my left ear. It sent shivers up & down my spine! I loved every moment of it! I've never been too big into horror games, but this one has got me hooked. I've recommended it to numerous friends trying to get them involved. 

I'm really looking forward to seeing the development on this game and where it will be when it goes full release next year!

Bought the game partially as a joke horror game that me and 3 other friends expected to be a 1 off game experience and ended up absolutely loving the game. I have full intention to continue playing and look forward to unlocking the content further in the game. The game has quite a few bugs and unexplained mechanics however, but it is sort of expected for an early-access game so I'll let it slide. As long as the game continues to receive updates and more content is explained and fleshed out I can see this game being one of my favorite co-op games. Also at the time of writing this, the developer seems to be very engaged with the community, at least on steam, and I see that as very promising for the future of this game. So in short Phasmophobia is by no means a perfect game, but has the potential to become a favorite game to play with friends. Each hunt has honestly felt unique and has kept me invested. And to the Developer(s), if you are reading this, I am looking forward to how this game progresses and will be following it closely!

Fun game for the price. Team Ghost Hunting Experience. As a disclaimer, I played it on PC, and NOT VR. Overall the objective of the game is to figure out what type of ghost is in the investigation property. There are tools that will help you gather evidence and ultimately your team needs to deduct the type of ghost. Funny, Scary, and Entertaining game mechanics that you don't typically see in horror games, specifically because this is a team-based game. I HATE Horror games, especially ones with jumpscares (which this game thankfully has none of)... but this is one of the best ones I have ever played. Grab some friends and experience the best paranormal ghost-hunting game out there. No jumpscares*, very well done equipment use, and different each playthrough.

*There are technically no jumpscares if you were worried about it like I was. Like in your face, at least. The closest you get is just when the ghost phases through a wall or just suddenly appears in front of you. It's not scripted intentionally, and sometimes you don't see it at all. But that's the fun. Death animation is just hands grabbing you from the back very slowly, giving you time to realize what's happening. The scariest part of the game is walking through a dark house when the lights flicker off unknowing if you're going to be next.

For being in Early Access, this is extremely well done. Very little bugs, and I'm super excited to see what's added in the future.

Before I begin, I played using a VR Headset so experience with keyboard and mouse could be totally different. 

     I first found out about this game through youtubers and it caught my attention. After watching many videos I decided to buy it. When first going into the game, it makes you go through a ghost hunting tutorial where you'll be taught the basics of the game, like what an EMF detector does or how to identify the type of ghost that is haunting the location you are in. After passing the tutorial, you can now access multiplayer where you will be put with up to 4 people to ghost hunt different locations. 

     My first mission wasn't something to write home about as I was in a group of four, the players were friendly and basically made the atmosphere of the game light and jolly regardless of any ghosts in the room. We all stuck together and ended up completing the night with most objectives done (You are assigned 4 tasks to do before you are able to complete the night). It wasn't until the second job where the game truly shined. 
     
    After one of my teammates left, it was just down to three of us. No big deal as it was still fun. The location we next visited was a farm house, where the darkness reigned even with flashlights you could barely see. Our tasks were simple, take a picture of the entity haunting the location, capture its movements with a motion detector, and two others which I had forgotten about. This game utilizes speech recognition which players can use to interact with the ghosts, like saying phrases like "Are you here?"  "Show yourself" or even the entities name which you'll be shown on the job description. For this particular job, the entity would get angry if you say his name, so to capture a picture of him, we had to force him to show himself. 

     Now being new to the game, I had no idea what the ghosts would be like, the job I did before with the group I barely even saw a shadow of one. So when this entity appeared in front of us I was actually scared, it made noises similar to that of the Grudge and it looked like an overcooked bacon strip, which doesn't sound scary but it was terrifying at the time. After aggravating it, it choked and killed one of my teammates but we had captured a picture of it, completing a task so my remaining teammate and I ran out of the house and back into the van where we discovered I did not place the motion detector down to capture the movement of the entity. 

     Now the game does have a health percentage -isk meter in the form of sanity percentage. As you can guess the more ghost encounters you have, you lower your sanity becomes and when it hits 0 I presume you die (Haven't hit 0 as of yet). This is relevant to my story as we discovered we hadn't done enough tasks and my teammate had only 6% of his sanity left where I had 65%. It was up to me to go back into the farm house, place the motion detector and aggravate the entity to make him walk past the motion detector. This was not an easy task, in fact it was down right terrifying. With the flashlight beam weak and the house creaking, the atmosphere was really set. My heart my thumping and my legs were shaking, I returned to the corner where my teammate had died and placed the motion detector down. As I looked around the dark room, my fear kept rising as footsteps sounded throughout the house, and rose more when I yelled his name and all the lights in the house flickered and the sound he made could be heard in the darkness. I ran yelling like a madman as the front door shut blocking my escape. Luckily I was on vr and I passed through the door like I was a specter myself. In the end, I ended up disconnecting due to bad connection but it still was fun, 

     Of course like I mentioned before, your experience could be completely different if you don't game on VR. The fear factor was probably increase just because of that one reason. The game's atmosphere, when alone, does get to you and even though its a game the mind starts to create illusions regardless. This game is simple, all in all. No specific story (To my knowledge) and limited content (At the moment) but regardless of these factors, the game excels on what it intends to do. Make you scared sh*tless. 

     I recommend you buy this game if you are love horror, or a fan a shows like Ghost Hunters, or Ghost Adventures or If you just want a good scare.

I played this coop with 3 of my buddies and we had an amazing time. If you'd rather watch than read, just click this:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ehX-T7bvX7I

[b] [Thoughts and First Impressions] [/b]

Man, this game really threw me for a loop. On the one hand you have a well crafted 4 player co-op experience designed to just scare and unnerve the bejesus out of people and BOY does it work. On the other hand you have some negative elements such as the EXP curve, poor tutorial or explaining of game mechanics and often confusing encounters. Spoilers: None of the negative aspects of this game take away from the EXTRAORDINARILY fun gameplay loop and terror factors. 

This game is SO much fun. If you allow yourself to get into it and really try to hunt down the ghosts and take it seriously and work with your team... it's just one of the most fun experiences I've had in such a long time. Everyone has a tool and a job and you all have to stay in communication and work together in order to win at any particular level. Death is going to happen and it's tough to get around it, and even that's okay. It's just a terrifying experience from start to finish. Someone is going to have to walk into those pitch black rooms by themselves and try to communicate with the ghost over the radio. Someone is going to need to go to the basement in the pitch black and restart the fuse box. It's terrifying. It's fun. 

Find 3 friends that love to be scared and like a challenge. Get this game and go have a BLAST. You can see even as much as we were scared through the entire video the game was just a delight. We continue to play it a few days after purchase every night. 

It's SO scary. SO fun.

Pros:
- Many difficulties
- Many maps
- Forces you to use your critical thinking
- In game microphone (if you're far from your peer it's harder to hear them. if you're in a large hallway, your voice echoes)
- Many tools
- Missions provide cash if you're successful and can get extra cash if you do the extra objectives

Cons:
- Only 4 players (huge maps like Asylum makes it hard to find where the ghost is, big maps should allow more than 4 people)
- Sprinting (the sprinting is so B A D)
- Ghost voice that comes through the spirit box (in my opinion it should sound scary, but it's just regular voice)
- The algorithm to determine the ghost type is not great (there were times where we were certain about a type and we got it wrong even with all 3 evidences found)
- Losses all your items if your game crash or if the game bugs
- Sometimes the game will crash or bug (people get teleported back into the truck and screen keeps flashing for a while, really bad for people with epilepsy).
- Sometimes when joining a match you can't hear your peers microphones, so we need to restart the match (which leads to losing all your items, because if you leave an ongoing match then you "fail" the mission).

A note to the devs:
- Please fix the sprint! That sprint is too slow! Maybe add a breath bar that runs out if you keep sprinting for too long.
- Allow more than 4 players for medium to large sized maps!
- Fix the issue where you lose items when you crash or your game bugs.
- Enhance the algorithm to determine the ghost type, sometimes it's imprecise!

Fantastic game. At the time of the review, there are minor bugs to work out. The game is fully functional and for the most part will work properly. There are some UI changes that would be nice, but given that this game just came out, I'll give it a pass. (None of it game breaking).

Also the dev account is very active in the discussion board where he/she is answering a lot of player questions. It's very helpful for some of the more ambiguous aspects of this game.

There is also a degree of risk management in this game. You can contribute to the team gear on a mission, but if you die, you lose everything you contributed. So... don't die, or know when to cut your losses and bail on the mission. 

Also, HAVE A MICROPHONE. Two reasons: 1) there is no typing chat in this game. You technically don't need to coordinate, but you might need something someone is holding or want someone to help you with something. 2) if you don't have a microphone, you cannot talk with the ghost. Without it, you cannot verify one of the potential pieces of evidence and you'll need another player to do it, which they may be unable to.

Also VR works fantastic. Mostly stable and a spook to play. Regular non-VR is fun too. Cross-play between VR and non-VR works like a charm.

I dont have PC VR. That being said I play mouse and keyboard. This game is a BLAST, I'm a huge horror fan both movies and games. That being said this game is terrifying. If games like Layers Of Fear, Outlast, Dead By Daylight etc is too scary for you than this game will not be for you. The best part about this game is the 4 player co op. You basically just try to hunt ghosts & collect the evidence to identify which type of ghost you're up against.

I know this game is early access BUT my one complaint is the training. The training tells you what to do but not how to do it. More so learn as you go. I played with 3 friends and we left the first several games as we didnt know how to leave after one or 2 people in our crew died. Go back to the van and shut the door. You want to collect as much evidence as possible without dying. When you die you dont get paid. The more evidence you collect the more you get paid which opens it up to buying more tools for your next hunt. When you die you also lose the extra tools you bought.

The graphics are really nice (compared to most horror games around same price), when it's dark it is dark, the built in voice parameter is a very nice touch to this game (I suggest leaving your discord chat and indulging in in game). Lights dont always work so if you go in without a flashlight you better hold on to a friend... extremely excited to see where the developers take the game upon release. For the price I highly recommend to any horror fan or a group of friends to laugh at each others fears with. Especially with the Halloween season upon us in 2020, it's a good alternative to normal halloween traditions, but this game will stick no matter what time of the year you play.

You could categorize this game as an investigative horror-rogue-lite.

Now what does that mean? Each run you start in your truck, gather equipment and set it up in the area and, well, investigate on which type of ghost you are dealing with here. You also get random objectives like capture a picture of a paranormal activity, witness a paranormaal activity, gather DNA evidence, ... well you get the idea. After each run you get money and experience with which you unlock more stuff. 
Oh and did I meantion that you can actually talk to the ghost and it will give appropriate answers? We were in this room where we believed the ghost had its origin from and asked "Are you here?", the imidiate answer we got was "Here.". Next question was "Can you give us a sign then?", answer: "Yes.", next thing that happened was a little bit much but I can summerize it: Two of us started screaming, the ghost appeared in front of us and was starring and groaning at us, the light started to flicker and the last guy went back outside, yelling at us "Screw this shit, I am out!".

Its simple yet VERY atmospheric. I recommend it for everyone that doesnt like jumpscares but still enjoys a good horror experience.

Edit: My favorite Horror game now. So much replay value, intense moments and everyone I played with was really fun. It's truly a gem everyone has to play that likes horror games.

Must Haves

Bugs So Far

* Walkie Talkies seem to not reach as far as they should sometimes, e.g. sometimes can't hear the truck from the front door.

[b]Phasmophobia allows you to step into the soiled trousers of a terrified - yet determined - paranormal investigator pitted against an increasingly hostile paranormal force. It is up to you to figure out what it is, gather evidence, and get out while you still can.[/b]

This game is the perfect example of a good early access game, and it is exactly the sort of thing that other EA titles should aspire to be. 

Somehow - and much to my excitement - Phasmophobia  manages to remain as a scary horror experience despite the cooperative function. I think it's because when your friends are no longer around you, the spirits will only be coming for you. What's more is that the ghosts can hear you, so are you ever truly alone? 

Phasmophobia in its early access state provides you with varied locations and equipment, as well as ten types of paranormal beings to hunt.  This content comes at you at a steady pace through the use of their progression system, which ensures new content for hours to come. All of this adds up to varied investigations every time you play it, with more content surely to be added by the developer in the future. 

There is plenty of room for polish, but I highly recommend this game because of the solid, functional features already found inside the game.

Playing with a group of 3 we had no idea what we were getting ourselves into, but had a fantastic time so far, game really puts the shit into you at times, even with 3 streams going, everyone enjoyed it!

Phasmophobia is still in early access, and a very early build at that, so things are subject to change as the game gets updated especially with how frequently they seem to be updating it. With that out of the way, the game at the time of this review already has plenty of elements in place that make it a great horror game. There are a variety of paranormal entities (about 10-12 or so?) that make every run a unique experience. This game can be enjoyed singleplayer, but the true amazement lies in the multiplayer aspect. Most horror games because exponentially less scary once you play with friends, which is what a lot of multiplayer horror games suffer from. However, Phasmophobia doesn't suffer from this issue as much. Even if you have a full group of 4 (Like I usually do), the game continues to feel scary by putting everyone on high alert, so you're constantly trying to operate as a cohesive unit while you're hunted by an invisible entity. It's also terrifying when you watch your friends get murdered one by one and you become the last one alive. Some ghosts require players to be alone to draw them out, so it's usually a big argument as to who is going to sit in the living room all by themselves while the rest watch on the night vision cameras. When this game isn't scary, it's definitely hilarious.

Despite the game being in essentially Alpha/Pre-Alpha, there are surprisingly few game-breaking bugs that make the experience unenjoyable. One large bug my group and I found was that a lot of the time our 4th person wouldn't load in and either get kicked to the main menu for no apparent reason or just crash their game. The in-game voice chat also had several issues where only certain people could hear each other. It also wasn't consistent in how this worked. Sometimes 1 person could hear the other 3 and they couldn't hear them, or 2 people could hear 1 person while 1 couldn't hear anyone, or any kind of combination you could imagine. At a point it game increasingly more frustrating so we decided to use Discord for all of our talking. The in-game voice recognition didn't seem to have many problems, and actually was quite accurate for picking up spoken words and phrases.

Overall, based on the current status, I'm going to give this game a 7/10. This game has some great features to it, and manages to feel scary even when in a group, especially on some of the larger and freaky maps (no spoilers however.) I highly recommend running through the training so you understand the different methods of figuring out which ghost you're dealing with. My group didn't do that and we struggled with our first 4 or so ghost hunts. There are some bugs that make the game hard to enjoy, but there are third party solutions to them (if you're not playing with randos of course) and overall they don't break the core of this game, which is ghost busting.

TL;DR Good game with solid mechanics, with few bugs that don't break the core element of horror this game portrays. I could definitely see this becoming something much greater than it is already.

P.S you have to pull the crucifix out while the ghost is hunting you, you can't just hold it out. Figured that out the hard way ;)

[h1] VR Index Experience [/h1]

[b]Hey there demons, it's me...ya boi.[/b]

[b][u]Why I Picked It Up[/u][/b]
I don't play 'horror' genre games. But I lent my Oculus Rift to my friend recently so I could have someone to play games with in VR. We started browsing new trending VR games and we noticed Phasmophobia, watched the trailer and he got soo excited he bought it right away. I decided to join.

[i]Note: You need to complete 'training' before being able to play with friends. So I went into 'training' and quit to put my graphics up and it completed training when I came back, so I went in with [b]NO EXPIERENCE[/b][/i]

[b][u]What It Felt Like[/u][/b]
Knowing from the trailer it seemed to be of a 'ghost hunting' theme and it's spot on. You really feel like you are a ghost hunter. With all the items you have [you can buy A LOT more, but I sucked ass for the 2 hours I did play it and only made 20$] it makes everything very interesting. We split the 'tools' among our 2 man team and went in doing our best to learn it as we played normal. Lets just say I loved it that much for the non-horror fan I was. I ended up shaking in my boots wanting more.[url=https://www.twitch.tv/videos/747567964]A Highlight Of That For Anyone Interested[/url]

[b][u]How does it feel? [Movement/Gameplay][/u][/b]
[b]The good:[/b]
- Beautiful as hell and runs on my 1660 super while streaming.
- No visual breaks of immersion [besides your own vr hands]
- Quick loading times
- Impressive voice local communication
- A nice amount of 'tools' / 'gadgets' you can use
- You can yell at ghosts and they hear you

[b]Not Good Not Bad:[/b]
- VR characters tend to do the Michael Jackson lean 80% of the time after moving.
- [strike]You can yell at ghosts and they hear you[/strike]
- Hard to open doors the way you want. At least with index.

[b]The Bad:[/b]
- There is no finger tracking / hand animations [at least at the time of this review]
- [strike]You can yell at ghosts and they hear you[/strike]
- Can't get 'teleport grab' to work properly on index.
- No hit sounds. AKA if you pick up a hammer and smack a metal, it don't go 'ting'
- Your ugly ass VR hands. 

+ You can set it so you have to continue to [i]hold[/i] the items, so when you get scared and fling your hands and let go you lose your currently held items and it causes you to lose your source of light so you panic, freak out and then have to change pants. 

[b]10/10 would recommend extra pares of pants[/b]

In the 10 or so hours that I have played this game, Phasmophobia has been a really fun play with my other 3 friends. 
Phasmophobia is a game about paranormal investigations, where you search a building to find evidence of paranormal activity. The game delivers this concept very well, while being simple and easy to understand when you are first starting out. The game is equally creepy and fun to play, even while I was speedrunning. 
The replayability of this game is also pretty good, with a levelling system and coins system so you can buy equipment to capture evidence for ghost activity. Although you can get a fair amount of experience while completing objectives, it can be tedious to level up if you don’t really know what to do.
The graphics are also pretty decent, but if you are playing in VR, then I don’t really think it would matter, unlike the audio which gives the atmosphere a bit of spook.
The only thing I would have to complain about is the bugs. There aren’t too many bugs but when there are it could be a bit annoying to play at times. Especially in VR, if you are backed up into a wall it would bug out and teleport you to someplace else.
Overall this game is very well made for a solo developer, I can’t wait to see what he has to bring in the later updates. It’s a yes from me!
Even without VR it is scary as shit. How can I not recommend it?

Awesome deal for $12. It's basically a spooky game of clue. You need to equip a bunch of tools and try to find evidence that points to a particular kind of spirit. It's clearly still in early access, but it is already a lot of fun and there are a ton of ways they could improve on the concept.

[h1]Experienced on Windows Mixed Reality[/h1]

You can view my review & gameplay here: https://youtu.be/S7rSgub_1bw

If you ever wanted to be a paranormal investigator like on Ghost Hunters or Paranormal State, but for real instead of those grifters, then this is the game for you. Even though it is in Early Access and buggy at the moment, there's enough here to make for a very memorable and spooky experience. 

This game is definitely geared for online coop play, however, you can play solo. You'll have take on different jobs where you go to different sites and investigate several different paranormal entities. You'll have tools like an EMF meter, or UV lights, or spirit boxes. 

There's a surprising amount of depth to this game as you try to uncover the mysteries of each job. You'll also have some side tasks to accomplish for extra money and experience, such as taking a photo of the paranormal entity or get the freezing temperature checked. The locations can be pretty dark, but this game does a nice job with the use of light and shadows and strange sounds all around. There's not a lot of jump scares, instead this game relies on the slow building of tension. Of course, if you're not careful, it could be the death of you.

The game is running on the Unity Engine. I was usually getting a steady 90 frames per second on my 1060 GTX. There is full locomotion plus smooth turning available, along with teleportation. Unfortunately, the locomotion was a bit too slow for my taste. I also experienced an issue where my teleportation stopped working. Also, my turning would intermittently stop working as well.

I also experienced several connection issues. Even when I did connect to an online group, I would get kicked out of the group most of the time almost immediately upon joining. The good news is that there are a lot of people online for this game, although many are Non-VR. I also experienced several freezes at the loading screens where I would have to manually quit the game to get it work properly again.

Despite all the issues I experienced, I still recommend this game. It was a blast to play when it worked properly. This is already one of the better VR horror experiences and might even be the definitive horror experience in VR once all the bugs are smoothed out and the gameplay is polished up. This is a must buy for any VR horror fan. 

[b]Rate 7/10. Buggy game, but it is in Early Access. I had fun & it got me scared. I already feel like I got my money's worth. [/b]

[h1]Phasmophobia Did Not Meet Expectations. [/h1]

[b]The Good[/b]

I do have to give props to a few things I've experienced while playing. The game, visually, looks amazing. I was sucked into it right away because of the visual aspect of the game and the sound. The use of the tools the player were equipped with made the game feel realistic. Unfortunately the bad out weighed the good for me.

[b]The Bad[/b]

The game was so boring and confusing. I understand there has to be a learning curve, but the game didn't give me enough to [i]want[/i] to invest any more time into it. The controls were confusing right away jumping into the game. The door was locked and after a while i discovered where the key was to unlock it, but I couldn't pick it up. I can only hold so many things at once, but nothing told me that, so i thought the key wasn't meant to be picked up. Later on i finally discovered the controls on the TV, which was fine, but could of been presented to me earlier before wasting all of my time discovering it. I enjoy fumbling through a game, but only if I'm [i]playing[/i] the game. In this case I feel like it was a waste of time. 

The noise and certain items randomly moving was awesome, but i expected more. I took my time searching the house before I got to the kitchen and was disappointed nothing jumped out at me or more went on. The scene was spooky, but that's all. Same with the ending. It was very... anti-climatic.

I wanted to like this game, but just couldn't to bring myself to invest more time into it with little reward. I played the first mission (after) tutorial solo and was very upset it was the same setting all over again. I will maybe try the game out again and change this review after it is developed more.
Very amazing game! I'm level 14 doing some intermediate missions! Lots of scares and laughs! 10/10 honestly KEEP IT COMING. EVEN GAVE ME SOME DREAMS wooooooooo

Honestly the first time that a game has genuinely made me panic and feel uneasy. Nothing like running into a dark room, yelling the ghosts name, then proceed to lock the doors and flicker the lights to scare some sense into you.

Super fun experience with my 3 pals playing the game for the first time.

Things I'd like to see fixed / added to the game:

1. Valve Knuckles controllers have weird inconsistencies when your thumb touches the sensor pad, "track button". It's like a watered down locomotion option that does a quarter of what the joysticks do.
You'll accidentally rest your thumbs on the pad, then rotate in a slow, choppy manner or strafe in a random direction.

2. The video camera has absolutely no video display on the physical camera itself!
At the beginning of my experience, with 1 flashlight, 1 very dim UV light, and 3 other people, I was sad to see that you couldn't explore the dark environments with the night vision on the video camera.

Please add a display for the video camera on the camera itself. This would boost immersion, considering almost all cameras have their own built-in displays.

3. Honestly, any additional shadow forms for the ghost to compliment the creepy atmosphere. Sure the ghost you're hunting is terrifying as is, but ghosts are believed to have multiple forms depending on their "charge". That's why ghost hunters feed them electronics to help communicate.

Instead of seeing the ghost the one time where it's a solid form, having them appear around you as a disfigured shadow person would be absolutely chilling.

I absolutely loved playing this game with a group of my friends. The people in the other reviews were right, it actually is a scary game. I thought I was used to the "horror aspects" until we encountered (and I saw with my own eyes) a very aggressive and 10 EMF level Oni who had a sickle for a weapon. It was genuinely terrifying and unsettling so I stayed in the truck to watch everyone else's sanity levels and EMF scales... and my group and I are still in amateur jobs currently, which makes me excited for what's to face next. 

With that being said, this game is extremely enjoyable and has barely any bugs, even in it's early access stage, which is very refreshing. It's a perfect mix of horror and humour (when played with friends). I'm not sure how single-player is because it's too scary for me to go at it alone, but it is available if you choose to do that. The game encompasses a very intriguing variety of supernatural entities, some being from different cultures on other sides of the planet. (I won't say ghosts because some are demons) There are also plenty of houses/maps to investigate, and you can play with 3 other people at once. 

The "ghosts" also seem to have different personalities, we met another Oni that we actually made fun of because he looked like a decrepit old man and all he did was show himself to us multiple times and not do anything, he seemed to be a bit shy. The other Oni I mentioned was hell-bent on killing most of my party and even wrote "Die" multiple times in our ghost-writing notebook we placed for him. If you didn't know, the ghosts can also hear you and your party members and respond, they also get mad about certain things. Well, anyways, I like this game a lot and I'm excited to see what new content the game developers will add, as it is awesome already.

for the price of this game though i especially am getting more than my moneys worth. The best horror game of this year hands down.

And I thought Walking Dead Saints & Sinners was scary... Honestly though, this game is my favorite out of any of my VR games or even non VR games that I have played. The up to 4 player coop provides a unique experience that no other horror game has to offer and it does it well. The game is quite confusing when you first start off even if you do the training but that is what I love so much about it, you have to actually play to get good and understand what type of ghosts you are dealing with. Not to mention, with so much randomness and variety between ghosts and how unpredictable they are you will never be left disappointed when going to hunt for some ghosts. This game truly captures what horror is all about and that is the immersion, unpredictability, suspense, and overall non repetitiveness. 

The game does have jumpscares which any horror game should but what really makes this game stand out is that they are to a minimum and it can come out of anywhere which is guaranteed to scare even the toughest of people. The game does have its bugs but none of them that I have experienced myself are that game breaking, in VR you can phase and noclip a little bit through things such as doors and stuff if your at the right angle but honestly most of the time you will only do that if you do it intentionally. With the randomness also comes that great amount of suspense as you never know what that ghost is going to decide to do, one second your flashlights are working all fine and everyone is just searching, the next your lights are flickering the flashlights are turning on and off and you see a ghost at the bottom of the stares for a split second then the next it is gone and is right next to you killing your teammate. Or, even when everyone is just about to leave the house to check something in the truck and as the last person is coming out that door shuts right in their face and locks then the ghost pops out of nowhere and jumpscares the living hell out of you and has everyone freaking out. Even the moments where you are expecting something to happen still tend to scare the living mess out of you and keep you on your toes.

Also, don't forget that this game was mostly coded by just a single person and the amount of potential it has to be one of the greatest VR games ever is unlimited. With so much variety and how much the devs truly care about the game you are guaranteed to have a good experience. Plus, the models for the ghosts are extremely terrifying and will have you so shooken up the second you even catch a glimpse of it in the corner of your eye. The dev that made this game knows what true horror games should have and how they should be done and it honestly shows. It doesn't fail in any aspect of horror, it always keeps you immersed and wanting more when you are not playing it. This game is honestly so scary I slept with the lights on and so did a few of my friends.

Don't even forget about the variety in maps also, with maps like asylum and highschool you are guaranteed to be shaken when seeing or even being in those maps, and that isn't even including what is planned to come in the near future such as a mansion, apartment, and even a prison map. The dev is extremely open to suggestions and does his hardest to fix any bugs that pop up in the game. I have had the most fun I have ever had when playing a VR game and the replayability on this game is INSANE. To sum up this review, the game captures everything horror should have perfectly. 

Immersion - Check
Suspense - Check
Unpredictability - Check
Will always keep you on your toes and being terrified every second of the ghost hunt - Check

TLDR; I recommend this game to absolutely everyone whether you enjoy horror or not it will be some of the best and scariest moments ever. Not to mention, you can play it on just your PC or VR and they can mix so PC can play with VR vice versa.

So far, while I only have almost 6 hours in the game, that is definitely enough to give a review. First thing is first: up front, I am not on VR, as I don't have a VR headset. Yet. This game strikes me as one that would be phenominal in VR, however, and if I ever get a headset, this game is at the top of my "to get in VR" list.

This review will be focused on the standard version, so those without VR headsets, I'll talk about how it feels/controls.

First, let's rate the concept. I give the concept (or overall idea of the game) an 8/10. The idea of being a ghost hunter trying to make some money, but ACTUALLY risking their lives is a really good idea. This is one of those ideas with so much potential, and for now I can safely say Phantasmophobia meets the potential!

Controls (PC Only): Solid 7/10. The controls on PC don't feel super clunky like some games that have both a VR and a standard mode. The non VR version was very clearly NOT just an afterthought, as the game feels very solid to play. Controls are responsive, I haven't noticed anything overtly clunky--except for one tiny thing: opening doors. Sometimes the doors want to "stick" even when they are supposed to be unlocked. A small, minor complaint here, but that is why it got a 7 instead of an 8. The other missing points comes from run speed; the "running" feels pretty slow. Without being able to play in VR though, I can't say if that is just a PC thing or if it feels the same way for VR players.

Gameplay: Solid 9/10. The game has some bugs, but there is a LOT of content here. For one, the houses seem to spawn slightly differently each time. The ghost can be one of many different types, and the main rooms it haunts will switch every playthrough. So even the same maps can play very different. The equipment works really well and convincingly accurate to IRL equipment. Playing with friends is a very solid experience. The atmosphere is creepy as hell, and the ghost types themselves are very scary. This is one of those games that shines despite some bugs such as clipping, or other minor things.

Horror/atmosphere: 10/10 here.  The game has a lot of jump scares, but where it differs from other games is it ALSO has a LOT of atmospheric terror. Even with friends the game is scary as hell, let alone playing by yourself. The ambiance is great, the noises and things the different ghosts can do to scare you is really well thought out. This game will scare you before you ever even come close to seeing whatever haunts the building you are in, let alone if you DO have the misfortune of seeing it!

Developer Activity: This is a big one for most considering playing an early access game. The devs are super active in their discord and this game has been updated twice in the two days I have been playing it. They actively answer questions and take feedback given in their bug reports very seriously. 10/10 here, this is easily one of the most active devs I've seen in an early access game. This is definitely not abandonware!

OVERALL: I would give this game a solid 8/10. The few bugs here and there, and the couple minor issues I mentioned with controls knock off a few points, preventing me from giving it a 10. This game honestly could be $30 dollars and still worthwhile. The devs are super active and supporting of their game, and they listen to feedback. The game is legitimately fun to play, the horror aspect is amazing, the game gets your blood pumping!

If you ever wanted to be a paranormal investigator, this game gives you that experience and more. Easy for me to recommend, solid title, and I very much look forward to seeing what happens moving forward with this game. Also, streamers out there: This is a game that is SUPER fun to watch, so if you stream--this is a must have!

I have wanted a game like this for so long. For too long have I played puzzle games masked as a horror with spooky jump scares to freak me out. 

Phasmophobia offers a hunting experience akin to the classic ghost hunting television shows, and it does it well. I'm not puzzling with a scary entity chasing me constantly through hallways, I'm scared by the silence and the eerie noises that subtly happen now and then as I hope to gain evidence of ghostly apparitions and survive the night with three friends. 
Every time I successfully capture footage, I gain experience and income that I can use to buy new ghost hunting equipment. Static Cameras, Flashlights, and even Spirit Boxes, cause you can be damned sure the developer gave the ghosts the ability to listen to your in-game voice and react with it. It doesn't like you saying it's voice? Too bad you said it too many times and now that vengeful spirit is hunting you down. 

With added Virtual Reality compatibility, this is a real scary boi, and I love it.

This game has refreshingly original gameplay mechanics. The developers created a tension and build up of fear that is achieved through subtly instead of cheap jump scares.  There are currently 10 different kinds of spirits with different appearances. Each have different characteristics which you must identify before ultimately taking a picture of. Through the use of room temperature, spirit boxes, journals, smudge sticks, crucifixes, uv light, cameras, night vision cams, radio comms, etc, you can track the spirit and gather information.

The gameplay mechanics work really well with the (up to) 4 player co-op. A player can use the ghost hunting van outside the building can be used to relay important information to the others inside, or everyone can go inside at once to get closer to winning. Once you finally get a photograph of the spirit, it is saved in your player notebook as part of the greater collection. You finish the round by closing the van door and heading out of the area.

There are optional objectives for each round and with the money you earn, you can purchase more ghost hunting tools which can be lost in a failed round. I highly recommend this game for people who enjoy vr gaming, suspenseful gameplay, anything paranormal, and cooperative play.

Pros:
-Game runs beautifully and servers are surprisingly good for a brand new game
-The amount of realism with the tools, like the EMF reader.
-The 3D sound is terrifying 
-The creaks of the houses/farms give it an eerie feeling

Cons:
-4 players does not seem enough, maybe at most make it 5-8 players if possible
-The radio is loud, ear sharpingly loud, fix that and it would be good
-There should be some type of storyline for every house, and the spirits last name should not always be Brown. 

Other than that, this game is a solid 9/10, and would recommend for anyone who has VR and wants a good scare.

Multiplayer horror is a very difficult genre to get correct, and this title nails it. The atmosphere in this game is absolutely terrifying and it reminds me of another VR (exorcism) game which relies on tension and not jumpscares to frighten. So far, there appears to be a lot of replay value as the ghosts and investigations change for every job you take. I definitely recommend this title right now, even in Early Access; it is very well polished, the mechanics function properly, and it's honestly just a whole lot of FUN.
